Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 02:45PM Lauralynne wrote: Hi Oz- I had skin mets on my right chest and over mastectomy site and had radiation treatments to the area and it burnt them all away.  The mets have not reappeared in the site treated with radiation.  I finished radiation in October and no new mets have been able to grow in the radiated area.  I do have a few small mets on the left side, but they are not giving me trouble at the moment, so will leave them be. Skin mets are hard to treat, as you know.  I have read they come and go, and never really go away for good.  If they are bothering you, I would recommend the radiation.  Although my radiation oncologist really wanted to burn the skin bad to get through the layers of skin and it was...um.....painful.....but worked.  Good Luck Oz. Lauralynne

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2008 04:07AM Lauralynne wrote: Hi Kim- I am similar to you in that my breast cancer spread to lungs, liver and now brain mets too. I was in ER and hospital for 5 days after having excruciating headaches, then the ER doc told me the bad news of brain mets.  Radiation treatment began that day, 15 treatments in all.  Just finished last week, tapering off Decadron.  Today was fisrt chemo after 4 week delay because of whole brain radiation.  I was having balance problems, falling to left side and the headaches.   Did your doc recommend whole brain radiation, or what is your treatment plan now?  I will let the radiation continue to work and get a scan in 6 weeks to see exact locations of mets and how many, at this point, we do not know extent.   Cancer sucks. Good luck, good vibes and let us know as these boards and veteran posters know so much and give their advice so freely.  Lots of support and information to help us along here.  Lauralynne

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 07:20PM Lauralynne wrote: Hi Donna, I currently have skin mets.  At first, I had 3 very small red bumps on my chest and when I touched them, they felt like a little grain of coarse salt underneah the skin.   I developed others that were red, raised lumps, like small bug bites and I also have a few that are flesh-colored and look like small warts.  They can vary as to how they present.  They have all been on my chest area.  I have read some women have them on their back also, but mine are confined to chest area.  Mine do not itch or cause my any problems, it is just annoying to have to look at them.  I have had mine for over a year now. Hope this helps.  Also the pictures in the link above my message (from Jelly) are accurate.   Lauralynne
Posts.Title: Skin Mets donnaakadj Bmarie

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2007 09:39AM Lauralynne wrote: Hi Linda- Yes, I was on Abraxane/Avastin from Jan through June of this year when progression was noted in my neck nodes, so we stopped it.   I then started a trial of Sutent and did that for 8 weeks but the side effects were too much for me to handle and there also was progression of skin metastases on my chest wall while on Sutent.  I am now on "Alimta", which is not an approved breast cancer drug but is for lung cancer.  Anyway, it seems to be working and my latests scans showed no progression in nodes.  I do have lesions all over my chest but am currently undergoing radiation and it seems to be clearing them up.  I will stay on Alimta and get rescanned in a month or so.  It seems at stage IV, my body builds up an immunity to each chemo I have been given, so we have to go on to the next one.  I like Alimta....its about a 15 minute IV infusion and side effects are minimal.  I read the boards daily, but post infrequently.  Thank you for thinking of me.  I will post again when I have some news of some sort.   ~~~Hugs, Laura

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2008 07:29PM Lauralynne wrote: Hi Stephanie- Since it is your first appointment, and you technically haven't had any radiation yet I would drive myself tomorrow, then ask them what they say about driving in the future.  Some people have visual impairment, balance issues, etc.  What are your main symptoms (beside headache, I assume?)   You should be fine tomorrow.  I have had 11 WBR and feel pretty good, except Decadron is causing me side-effects.  If you are not on any medication that prevents driving, I say go for it.  I am that type of girl to do it on my own.   But, I will say friends have been begging to help me with daily appointments, so I let them drive me and get some girlfriend-time with them. Good luck and BE CAREFUL, and call a taxi if all else fails, okay?   Lauralynne

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 06:07PM Lauralynne wrote: I was on Ixempra begining in December.  The side effects were bone pain, fatigue and neuropathy the first 4 days after treatment.  It was  pretty intense there for a few days but subsided over time.   Although this drug already failed me (just had CT scan the other day), I have a friend who had 5 treatments so far and it is kicking her cancer to near remission!  She's having such a good response, she will stay on it.  So, IT does work.  Just try to hang in there with the side effects and know that they don't last for long.  I did loose my hair...although my friend only had hers thin out.  Lucky girl.  Good luck to you.  Keep us posted, okay? Lauralynne

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2008 11:13PM Lauralynne wrote: Oh Deb- We understand that you are SICK OF THIS WHOLE THING, because we are SICK OF IT TOO!  Ugh.  How much can one person take?  Such siffering!  I just got new glasses because I cannot see anything clear and understand the frustration you feel. I just finished 15 whole brain radiation treatments.  Then the eye doctor yesterday tells me I have a metastasis in my eye!  Vision will only get worse.  So, I know how sick-of-it you are, because I am too.  We just have to keep going on and do the best we can.   I have enjoyed your posts, love your same avatar for years now.  I am triple negative like you.  Hang in there Deb.  We are all pulling for you and for your doctors to come up with a solution to let you have better quality of life.  That's what we want most now, right, just some quality of life.  Prayers and good vibes sent to you tonight. Lauralynne
